intro: Kibara karengana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the genus Saintpaulia and is characterized by its velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soil and thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Kibara karengana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
